results.title: Heidi
results.creator_credit: Allan Dwan, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Shirley Temple collection”.
Shirley Temple portrays the spirited young heroine of Johanna Spyri’s popular children’s novel giving her rich emotion and infinte charm. When her Aunt tires of caring for her, orphan Heidi is taken to the Swiss mountains to live with her gruff grandfather (Jean Hersholt), a hermit who comes to adore her. However, the Aunt returns to steal Heidi and sells her to a family whose invalid daughter (Marcia Mae Jones) needs a companion. Bullied by an evil governess (Mary Nash), Heidi still charms the entire household and never stops trying to return to her beloved grandfather. Colourised version.

results.title: Sommersby
results.creator_credit: Jon Amiel, Arnon Milchan, Alcor Films, Regency Enterprises and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: People remembered Jack Sommersby as a bitter, loutish man but when he returns home after the Civil War, he’s tender, caring and resourceful. Has the war changed him… or is the man calling himself Jack Sommersby an impostor? Richard Gere and Jodie Foster are a match for the ages in Sommersby, a period romance rich in mystery, detail and splendid performances. They portray Jack and Laurel Sommersby, whose love grows as the suspicions about Jack mount. If he isn’t the man she married, Laurel knows he is the man she always wanted, but an ultimate test of their love and Jack’s identity awaits. Jack must stand trial for his life and the outcome makes for a memorable film.

results.title: Free Willy
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Jennie Lew-Tugend, Lauren Shuler, Alcor Films, Regency Enterprises and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: This is a heart warming and touching story about the friendship that develops between an abandoned child living in a foster home and an Orca (Killer Whale) who is confined in a too-small tank at Pacific Northwest aquatic park. At night Willy cries out to his family who frolic in the nearby bay. No-one can undestand his cries and moods - no one except Jesse (Jason James Richter) a 12 year old boy who knows what it is like to be without a family.

results.title: This boy's life
results.creator_credit: Michael Caton-Jones, Art Linson, Odyssey, Regency Enterprises and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This is the captivating true story based on the book by Tobias Wolff. Growing up is never easy but for Tobias Wolff (Leonardo DiCaprio) it’s sheer hell. His mother, Caroline (Ellen Barkin), has just married Dwight Hansen (Robert De Niro), a psychotic disciplinarian who rules with an iron fist and an explosive temper. Instead of the bright future his mother promised him, Tobias must now endure constant brutality from his sadistic stepfather. There is a way out though; and with the will to fight and courage way beyond his years, Tobias just might find it. An absorbing and thoughtful story is brought to life by the gripping performances of the stars.

results.title: Captain Blood
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Cosmopolitan and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Peter Blood, a young doctor unjustly condemned for treating rebels is sentenced to slavery. Arabella, the beautiful niece of a cruel plantation owner, buys him, but Blood and his mates eventually escape and begin a career of piracy, gallantly fighting off adversaries on the high seas. After a strange twist of fate, Arabella and Blood meet again and justice and romance prevail. This film, with its thrilling sea battles launched the careers of Errol Flynn and Olivia de Havilland in the title roles.

results.title: High hopes
results.creator_credit: Mike Leigh, Simon Channing-Williams and Portman Film
results.brief_description: Winner of the International Critics Award, Mike Leigh’s tragi-comedy depicts Great Britain as a divided serfdom. One half of the population is in thrall to Dayglo dreams of social ascent, the other half to dissent and wistful radicalism. In converted slum-lands, yuppies live side by side with the last surviving council tenants, and in stubborn bedsits, the last surviving Marxists hold out, growing unwashed beards with the devotion of scientists. The film’s triumph is the depiction, at once satirical and compassionate, of its two aging Marxists, two lost souls like you and me, who soldier on with their small lives while the large world outside moves inevitably towards eternity or Armageddon.

results.title: The Grifters
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Jim Painten, Martin Scorsese, Robert A. Harris and Cineplex Odeon Films
results.brief_description: Set in the sleazy horse-tracks and gambling dens of contemporary L.A., “The Grifters” is a modern crime film that compares favourably to classic Hollywood film-noir films. Based on Jim Thompson’s pulp classic of the same name, this film shimmers with a consistent erotic tension. John Cusack is Roy, a young con-man who makes easy money off the gullible hordes that crowd Los Angeles. He finds himself caught in the middle of a dangerous tug-of-war between his prostitute girlfriend (Annette Bening) who wants him to committ a major scam, and his elegant but desperate mother, Lily (Angelica Huston), who has been hustling for years and wants to find a way out. Both are powerful women not adverse to using the people they love to get what they want, and their desperate machinations to achieve financial independance puts Roy’s very life at risk. This brilliantly directed film is a powerful study on the corrosive effects of power and money on human relationships. All the cast is outstanding but special mention must be made of the majestic Angelica Huston: her blazing and frightening performance as Lily is unforgettable.

results.title: Death of a nation: the Timor conspiracy
results.creator_credit: David Munro and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description: Written and presented by famed Australian journalist, John Pilger, this confronting documentary looks at the history of Indonesia’s occupation of East Timor. Since the 1975 invasion of this tiny island, the Indonesian military government has enacted a policy of genocide which has resulted in over 200,000 deaths and the attempted dismantling of the Timorese language, culture and identity. Much of this documentary was filmed undercover since, as the film makes vividly clear, one of the means by which the Indonenesian government has used to legitimise the occupation is through a blanket censoring of media images about and from East Timor. One of the most chilling aspects of this documentary is the evidence presented of the tacit assistance the governments of Australia, Great Britain and the United States have given to the invasion and occupation, an occupation which has seen some of the most barbaric human rights abuses of the twentieth century. The video includes interviews with former Western ambassadors to Indonesia; survivors of torture; and with FRETELIN guerrilla fighters who are still resisting the Indonesians without the assistance of any outside aid.
